title: Spain Flooding: Why Did It Take So Long to Warn Residents?
content: Torrential rains in Valencia, in eastern Spain, caused flooding that killed more than 200 people. The deluge started inland. It took the authorities hours to warn those downstream.
summary: Torrential rains in Valencia, in eastern Spain, caused flooding that killed more than 200 people. The deluge started inland. It took the authorities hours to warn those downstream.

title: Palestinians See Echoes of Israel’s Gaza War in West Bank Raids
content: West Bank residents say Israeli forces are adopting tactics similar to the ones they are deploying in Gaza, including airstrikes and the use of Palestinians as human shields.
summary: West Bank residents say Israeli forces are adopting tactics similar to the ones they are deploying in Gaza, including airstrikes and the use of Palestinians as human shields.

title: Egypt Feuds With Travel Blogger, Issuing 1,100-Word Response to Complaints
content: When a blogger criticized Cairo’s airport, Egypt’s government fired back, citing security footage, threatening legal action and asking, “Is it reasonable for a passenger to visit two lounges before a single flight?”
summary: When a blogger criticized Cairo’s airport, Egypt’s government fired back, citing security footage, threatening legal action and asking, “Is it reasonable for a passenger to visit two lounges before a single flight?”

title: Hezbollah Fires Waves of Projectiles Into Israel After Deadly Strike in Lebanon
content: The waves of attacks on Sunday came amid diplomatic efforts to reach a cease-fire in the conflict.

title: What Two Acclaimed Female-Directed Movies Say About Indian Cinema

title: The Problem of Sorcery in Papua New Guinea
content: Tragedies in Papua New Guinea are often followed by accusations of sorcery and unspeakable acts of violence. That cycle has become more brutal in recent years.
summary: Tragedies in Papua New Guinea are often followed by accusations of sorcery and unspeakable acts of violence. That cycle has become more brutal in recent years.

title: Brazil Cracked Down on Corruption. Now It’s Undoing the Case.
content: Operation Car Wash, which started in Brazil, revealed a bribery scheme that spanned at least 12 countries. Brazil’s Supreme Court has reversed much of its impact.
summary: Operation Car Wash, which started in Brazil, revealed a bribery scheme that spanned at least 12 countries. Brazil’s Supreme Court has reversed much of its impact.

title: Rabbi Found Dead in Dubai in What Israel Calls Terrorist Act
content: The Israeli authorities called the killing of Rabbi Zvi Kogan an act of terrorism. The Emirati government said it had arrested three people in connection with the murder.
summary: The Israeli authorities called the killing of Rabbi Zvi Kogan an act of terrorism. The Emirati government said it had arrested three people in connection with the murder.

title: What’s Behind Ukraine and Russia’s Missile Brinkmanship?
content: Tit-for-tat moves this week included the use of American-made ballistic missiles to strike inside Russia, and new nuclear threats from Moscow. Neither appear to have influenced the war on the ground.
summary: Tit-for-tat moves this week included the use of American-made ballistic missiles to strike inside Russia, and new nuclear threats from Moscow. Neither appear to have influenced the war on the ground.

title: How a Nigerian Nurse Abducted by Boko Haram Planned Her Escaped
content: After being abducted by an offshoot of Boko Haram in Nigeria six years ago, a Christian nurse describes her daring escape and how faith kept her alive.
summary: After being abducted by an offshoot of Boko Haram in Nigeria six years ago, a Christian nurse describes her daring escape and how faith kept her alive.

title: With Memes and in State Media, Many Russians Cheer on Putin’s Threats
content: While support for Vladimir V. Putin’s threats resounded in pro-war venues, some Russians reacted with worry, gallows humor and apathy to the suggestions of striking the West and using nuclear weapons.
summary: While support for Vladimir V. Putin’s threats resounded in pro-war venues, some Russians reacted with worry, gallows humor and apathy to the suggestions of striking the West and using nuclear weapons.

title: In South Africa, Food Poisoning Kills at Least 23 Children

title: World Seeks an End to Plastic Pollution at Talks in South Korea

title: 2-Year-Old Gorilla Dies After Being Struck by Hydraulic Door at Zoo
content: A Calgary Zoo staff member mistakenly activated a door that struck the western lowland gorilla named Eyare, a report found.

title: Madeleine Riffaud, ‘the Girl Who Saved Paris,’ Dies at 100
content: Humiliated by a Nazi officer as a teenager, she joined the French Resistance. By the time she was 20, she had killed a German soldier, survived torture and captured a supply train.
summary: Humiliated by a Nazi officer as a teenager, she joined the French Resistance. By the time she was 20, she had killed a German soldier, survived torture and captured a supply train.

title: Sectarian Violence Kills at Least 25 in Northwest Pakistan

title: Your Heart’s Desire

title: Alberta Breaks With the Canadian Pension Model
content: The provincial government abruptly purged the board and senior leaders of Alberta’s pension fund, defying a long-held principle that funds should be free of political interference.
summary: The provincial government abruptly purged the board and senior leaders of Alberta’s pension fund, defying a long-held principle that funds should be free of political interference.

title: Kayaker Trapped on Australian River Has Leg Amputated in 20-Hour Rescue

title: Hezbollah Said to Be Using Copy of Israeli Missile Against Israel

title: A Lesson for America? Reversing Populist Policies Is Tough, Poland Finds.

title: Iran Declares It Is Doing More Nuclear Enrichment After I.A.E.A. Rebuke
